com.ikalagaming.entity.component

Class HealthTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.entity.component.HealthTest

  • public class HealthTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests for the Health component
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HealthTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testDamage()
      Tests that damage works correctly, stays in bounds, and heals when negative.
      void testGetHealth()
      Ensures that the health value is set and returned properly and it stays inside the given min and max bounds for the health object.
      void testGetHealthPercentage()
      Finds the percentage health of random values in several different health ranges and ensures they match the reported percentage values.
      void testGetMaxHealth()
      Tests the max health is returned correctly
      void testGetMinHealth()
      Tests the min health is returned correctly
      void testGetType()
      Ensures the type of Health is "Health"
      void testHeal()
      Tests that healing works, stays inside bounds, and damages when negative.
      void testHealth()
      Tests that the default constructor has the correct values as specified in the documentation (that is, minimum of 0, maximum of 100, current of 100).
      void testHealthInt()
      Tests the constructor with one parameter for maximum value, using a small subset of values from the lowest to highest possible values and ensures they work.
      void testHealthIntInt()
      Tests the constructor with two parameters for min and max values, using a small subset of values from the lowest to highest possible values and ensures they work.
      void testHealthIntIntInt()
      Tests the constructor with three parameters for min, max and initial values, using a small subset of values from the lowest to highest possible values and ensures they work.
      void testIsDead()
      Ensures health reports death correctly and kills/revives while testing
      void testIsImmortal()
      Tests that health defaults to not immortal and sets it to immortal then back to mortal, testing after both changes.
      void testSetHealth()
      Tests that health is set correctly.
      void testSetImmortal()
      Tries a couple of patterns of setting health to immortal and not, testing that it worked each time.
      void testSetMaxHealth()
      Tests several max healths and ensures they were changed right
      void testSetMinHealth()
      Tests several min healths and ensures they were changed right

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Tests that the default constructor has the correct values as specified in the documentation (that is, minimum of 0, maximum of 100, current of 100).

        public void testIsDead()
        Ensures health reports death correctly and kills/revives while testing

      • testIsImmortal

        public void testIsImmortal()
        Tests that health defaults to not immortal and sets it to immortal then back to mortal, testing after both changes.

      • testSetHealth

        public void testSetHealth()
        Tests that health is set correctly. This is essentially the same test as the unit test for the getter.

      • testSetImmortal

        public void testSetImmortal()
        Tries a couple of patterns of setting health to immortal and not, testing that it worked each time.

      • testSetMaxHealth

        public void testSetMaxHealth()
        Tests several max healths and ensures they were changed right
